channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Fall 2024 URP Applications Now Being Accepted
item.description: The Office of Undergraduate Education is currently accepting Undergraduate Research Program (URP) applications for the Fall 2024 semester! Through the URP, full- and part-time undergraduate students may pursue research for academic credit or as a paid research assistant working in the labs of world-leading Rensselaer faculty researchers during the academic year.
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Open for CMDIS BYOND “Build Your Own Nano Device” Program
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 8, 2024 12:00 AM - Wed , September 4, 2024 5:00 PM - Cleanrooms play a crucial role in various industries, where contamination is minimized or eliminated during various manufacturing processes. The Center for Materials, Devices, and Integrated Systems’ Micro and Nanofabrication Clean Room is offering a program to provide specialized training and knowledge in clean room operations for undergraduate students to build a strong foundation; applications are due by September 4.
item.author: Students

item.title: Fellowship info Session to Highlight Competitions for Grad School Salary and Tuition
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 4, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Competitive fellowships provide salary and tuition for Masters and PhD students. All graduate students, juniors, seniors, and international students are welcome to attend this session to learn how to find and apply to appropriate programs that will fund fall 2025 and beyond. Register to attend or just drop in!

item.title: Don’t Miss the RPI Activities Fair!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 4, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM - This event will feature booths and tables representing a wide variety of student organizations, clubs, and extracurricular activities that range from academic and professional groups to cultural organizations, sports teams, hobby clubs, and volunteer opportunities.

item.title: Fall 2024 Study Abroad Info Session Slated for September 4
item.description: All undergraduates are welcome to join the Office of International Programs from noon to 1:00PM on Wednesday, September 4 in room 2602 of the Rensselaer Union for a Study Abroad info session and pizza lunch to learn about program opportunities, application procedures, and deadlines.
item.author: Students

item.title: Library to Hold Open House for New Undergraduate Students
item.description: All undergraduate students are welcome to stop by the Folsom Library between 2:00PM and 3:30PM on Wednesday, September 4 to learn about Library services and see demos of available resources, and also meet other new students! Attendees can also enter to win raffle prizes from local businesses, grab a free “library swag” bag, and enjoy some free ice cream, too!
item.author: Students

item.title: DotCIO Posts Security Warning Regarding Duo/MFA Passcodes
item.description: The Division of the Chief Information Officer is encouraging everyone to please be aware of sophisticated phishing attempts targeting our community, and to not provide their Duo codes in response to any text messages, phone calls, emails, or other communications they may receive. These requests are fraudulent and designed to steal your information and compromise your RCS account.
item.author: Community

item.title: RAA to Sponsor “College Discovery” Webinar September 11
item.description: In partnership with RPI’s Offices of Alumni Engagement and Enrollment Management, the Rensselaer Alumni Association will present a “College Discovery” webinar from 7:00PM to 8:30PM on Wednesday, September 11, covering a range of important topics for alumni who are preparing their children for the college selection, recruitment, and admissions process.

item.title: “Strategies on Flipping Your Course” Fac/Staff In-Person Workshop to Feature Rensselaer CS Lecturers
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Register to attend this session which will discuss the practice of moving traditional in-class lectures onto the web by creating engaging, media-rich content that students access before, during, or after class. John Sturman and Konstantin Kuzmin, both lecturers in Rensselaer’s Computer Science department, will also share their flipping/active implementations for their summer courses.
